revised_title: Density and Coefficient of Cubical Expansion of Ice: A New Method of Experiment
tldr: The author conducted experiments to determine the density and coefficient of cubical expansion of ice using a new method. They found that the density of artificial ice is about 0.916 gram per cubic centimeter, while natural ice has a density more than one part in a thousand greater. The study also showed that the same specimen of water can freeze into ice with different densities, limiting the accuracy of the Bunsen ice calorimeter in absolute determinations.
